text.p: These are the leading stories in the Namibia press on Thursday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The battle for the vice-presidency of the ruling party SWAPO party is reaching fever-pitch with the party's congress barely a week away.
- No immediate action will be taken against Central Veterinary Laboratory chief Otto Hubschle, after cabinet accused him of misconduct on Wednesday. He is alleged to have sold untested vaccines.

- President of the opposition DTA, Mishake Muyongo, said the debate around the third term for Namibia's president Sam Nujoma is not about the right of the Namibian people to change the constitution, but over the question whether it would be wise to do so.
- The Namibian government has received N$480 in foreign assistance for projects under the National Development Plan.
